gov.nist.csd.pm.pap.graph

Class MemGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nist.csd.pm.pap.graph.MemGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph

    public class MemGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph
    MemGraph is an in-memory implementation of the graph interface. It stores the IDs of the nodes in a DAG structure. And stores all other node information in a map for easy/fast retrieval.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemGraph()
      Default constructor to create an empty graph in memory.
      MemGraph(GraphLoader graphLoader)

      • createNode

        public long createNode(NodeContext node)
                throws PMException
        Create a node in the in-memory graph. The ID field of the passed Node must not be 0.
        Specified by:
        createNode in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        node - The context of the node to create. This includes the id, name, type, and properties.
        Returns:
        The ID that was passed as part of the node parameter.
        Throws:
        PMException - When the provided node is null.
        PMException - When the provided node has an ID of 0.
        PMException - When the provided node has a null or empty name.
        PMException - When the provided node has a null type.

      • updateNode

        public void updateNode(NodeContext node)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Update the name and properties of the node with the given ID. The node's existing properties will be overwritten by the ones provided. The name parameter is optional and will be ignored if null or empty. The properties parameter will be ignored only if null. If the map is empty, the node's properties will be overwritten with the empty map.
        Specified by:
        updateNode in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        node - The node to update. This includes the id, name, and properties.

      • getPolicies

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Long> getPolicies()
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Get the set of policy classes. This operation is run every time a decision is made, so a separate method is needed to improve efficiency. The returned set is just the IDs of each policy class.
        Specified by:
        getPolicies in interface Graph
        Returns:
        The set of policy class IDs.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.HashSet<NodeContext> getChildren(long nodeID)
                                           throws PMException
        Find all the nodes that are assigned to the given node.
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        nodeID - The ID of the node to get the children of.
        Returns:
        The set of nodes that are assigned to the given node. The returned set will include each node's information provided in NodeContext objects.
        Throws:
        PMException - If the provided nodeID does not exist in the graph.

               throws PMException
        Associate the User Attribute node and the target node.
        Specified by:
        associate in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        uaCtx - The information for the User Attribute in the association.
        targetCtx - The context information for the target of the association.
        operations - A Set of operations to add to the association.
        Throws:

      • getSourceAssociations

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> getSourceAssociations(long sourceID)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Retrieve the associations the given node is the source of. The source node of an association is always a User Attribute and this method will throw an exception if an invalid node is provided. The returned Map will contain the target and operations of each association.
        Specified by:
        getSourceAssociations in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        sourceID - The ID of the source node.
        Returns:
        A Map of the target node IDs and the operations for each association.

      • getTargetAssociations

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> getTargetAssociations(long targetID)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Retrieve the associations the given node is the target of. The target node can be an Object Attribute or a User Attribute. This method will throw an exception if a node of any other type is provided. The returned Map will contain the source node IDs and the operations of each association.
        Specified by:
        getTargetAssociations in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        targetID - the ID of the target node.
        Returns:
        A Map of the source Ids and the operations for each association.
